key_points: Jensen Ackles discussed his firearm training for the movie 'Rust' at a fan event days before a fatal on-set shooting.
A clip from Ackles' talk was widely circulated online but has since been deleted from many platforms.
In the video, Ackles described a brief training session with the film's armorer, focusing on how to load and fire a prop gun.
The fatal on-set accident resulted in the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and wounding of director Joel Souza.
Alec Baldwin was involved in the accident, discharging the prop gun that led to the tragedy.
There is no evidence suggesting Jensen Ackles was involved in the scene of the shooting.
Alec Baldwin expressed his shock and sadness over the accident on Twitter, stating he is cooperating with the investigation.
The Santa Fe County sheriff's office is investigating the type of projectile discharged and how.
Reports emerged that Baldwin was surprised upon allegedly being given a 'hot gun', not having experienced this before on set.
Ackles has not yet publicly commented on the accident or on his previously recorded gun training comments.
spokespersons: A spokesman for the Santa Fe County sheriff
